thread.title: Australia Institute calls on Fed Govt to stop approving new coal mines
thread.title_full: Australia Institute calls on Fed Govt to stop approving new coal mines

author: ABC Radio National
title: Australia Institute calls on Fed Govt to stop approving new coal mines
text:
Monday 19 October 2015 8:35AM (view full episode) 
The Federal Government appears to have ruled out giving Australia's biggest coal mine project a leg up in the form of taxpayer subsidies. 
Last week, the Turnbull Government granted approval for Adani's Carmichael coal mine in central Queensland's Galilee Basin. 
The approval came on the back of a recent warning by mining giant Glencore that any government subsidies for a new coal project could place existing mines in jeopardy. 
Speaking on ABC TV yesterday, Federal Energy Minister Josh Frydenberg moved to hose down speculation Adani could benefit from the Commonwealth's $5 billion Northern Australia fund. 
But the left-leaning think tank, The Australia Institute is calling on the Federal Government not only to withhold subsidies â€” but to stop approving new coal mines altogether.
